description: Describes one or more versions of a specified launch template. You can describe all versions, individual versions, or a range of versions. You can also describe all the latest versions or all the default versions of all the launch templates in your account.

parameters.name: LaunchTemplateId
parameters.description: The ID of the launch template. To describe one or more versions of a specified launch template, you must specify either the launch template ID or the launch template name, but not both. To describe all the latest or default launch template versions in your account, you must omit this parameter.

parameters.name: LaunchTemplateName
parameters.description: The name of the launch template. To describe one or more versions of a specified launch template, you must specify either the launch template name or the launch template ID, but not both. To describe all the latest or default launch template versions in your account, you must omit this parameter.

parameters.name: Versions
parameters.description: One or more versions of the launch template. Valid values depend on whether you are describing a specified launch template (by ID or name) or all launch templates in your account. To describe one or more versions of a specified launch template, valid values are $Latest, $Default, and numbers. To describe all launch templates in your account that are defined as the latest version, the valid value is $Latest. To describe all launch templates in your account that are defined as the default version, the valid value is $Default. You can specify $Latest and $Default in the same request. You cannot specify numbers. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters. create-time - The time the launch template version was created. ebs-optimized - A boolean that indicates whether the instance is optimized for Amazon EBS I/O. http-endpoint - Indicates whether the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances is enabled ( enabled | disabled). http-protocol-ipv4 - Indicates whether the IPv4 endpoint for the instance metadata service is enabled ( enabled | disabled). host-resource-group-arn - The ARN of the host resource group in which to launch the instances. http-tokens - The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests ( optional | required). iam-instance-profile - The ARN of the IAM instance profile. image-id - The ID of the AMI. instance-type - The instance type. is-default-version - A boolean that indicates whether the launch template version is the default version. kernel-id - The kernel ID. license-configuration-arn - The ARN of the license configuration. network-card-index - The index of the network card. ram-disk-id - The RAM disk ID. (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

parameters.name: ResolveAlias
parameters.description: If true, and if a Systems Manager parameter is specified for ImageId, the AMI ID is displayed in the response for imageId. If false, and if a Systems Manager parameter is specified for ImageId, the parameter is displayed in the response for imageId. For more information, see Use a Systems Manager parameter instead of an AMI ID in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Default: false.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateVersions
nested_items.description: Information about the launch template versions.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template.

nested_items.name: VersionNumber
nested_items.description: The version number.

nested_items.name: VersionDescription
nested_items.description: The description for the version.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The time the version was created.

nested_items.name: CreatedBy
nested_items.description: The principal that created the version.

nested_items.name: DefaultVersion
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the version is the default version.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateData
nested_items.description: Information about the launch template.

nested_items.name: KernelId
nested_items.description: The ID of the kernel, if applicable.

nested_items.name: EbsOptimized
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance is optimized for Amazon EBS I/O.

nested_items.name: IamInstanceProfile
nested_items.description: The IAM instance profile.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the instance profile.

nested_items.name: BlockDeviceMappings
nested_items.description: The block device mappings.

nested_items.name: DeviceName
nested_items.description: The device name.

nested_items.name: VirtualName
nested_items.description: The virtual device name (ephemeralN).

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the EBS volume is encrypted.

nested_items.name: DeleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the EBS volume is deleted on instance termination.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: of the customer managed KMS key to use for EBS encryption.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The ID of the snapshot.

nested_items.name: VolumeSize
nested_items.description: The size of the volume, in GiB.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: The throughput that the volume supports, in MiB/s.

nested_items.name: NoDevice
nested_items.description: To omit the device from the block device mapping, specify an empty string.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaces
nested_items.description: The network interfaces.

nested_items.name: AssociateCarrierIpAddress
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to associate a Carrier IP address with eth0 for a new network interface.

nested_items.name: AssociatePublicIpAddress
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to associate a public IPv4 address with eth0 for a new network interface.

nested_items.name: DeleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the network interface is deleted when the instance is terminated.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the network interface.

nested_items.name: DeviceIndex
nested_items.description: The device index for the network interface attachment.

nested_items.name: Groups
nested_items.description: The IDs of one or more security groups.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InterfaceType
nested_items.description: The type of network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6AddressCount
nested_items.description: The number of IPv6 addresses for the network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Addresses
nested_items.description: The IPv6 addresses for the network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Address
nested_items.description: The IPv6 address.

nested_items.name: IsPrimaryIpv6
nested_items.description: Determines if an IPv6 address associated with a network interface is the primary IPv6 address. When you enable an IPv6 GUA address to be a primary IPv6, the first IPv6 GUA will be made the primary IPv6 address until the instance is terminated or the network interface is detached. For more information, see RunInstances.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the network interface.

nested_items.name: PrivateIpAddress
nested_items.description: The primary private IPv4 address of the network interface.

nested_items.name: PrivateIpAddresses
nested_items.description: One or more private IPv4 addresses.

nested_items.name: Primary
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the private IPv4 address is the primary private IPv4 address. Only one IPv4 address can be designated as primary.

nested_items.name: PrivateIpAddress
nested_items.description: The private IPv4 address.

nested_items.name: SecondaryPrivateIpAddressCount
nested_items.description: The number of secondary private IPv4 addresses for the network interface.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet for the network interface.

nested_items.name: NetworkCardIndex
nested_items.description: The index of the network card.

nested_items.name: Ipv4Prefixes
nested_items.description: One or more IPv4 prefixes assigned to the network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv4Prefix
nested_items.description: The IPv4 delegated prefixes assigned to the network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv4PrefixCount
nested_items.description: The number of IPv4 prefixes that Amazon Web Services automatically assigned to the network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Prefixes
nested_items.description: One or more IPv6 prefixes assigned to the network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Prefix
nested_items.description: The IPv6 delegated prefixes assigned to the network interface.

nested_items.name: Ipv6PrefixCount
nested_items.description: The number of IPv6 prefixes that Amazon Web Services automatically assigned to the network interface.

nested_items.name: PrimaryIpv6
nested_items.description: The primary IPv6 address of the network interface. When you enable an IPv6 GUA address to be a primary IPv6, the first IPv6 GUA will be made the primary IPv6 address until the instance is terminated or the network interface is detached. For more information about primary IPv6 addresses, see RunInstances.

nested_items.name: EnaSrdSpecification
nested_items.description: Contains the ENA Express settings for instances launched from your launch template.

nested_items.name: EnaSrdEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether ENA Express is enabled for the network interface.

nested_items.name: EnaSrdUdpSpecification
nested_items.description: Configures ENA Express for UDP network traffic.

nested_items.name: EnaSrdUdpEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether UDP traffic to and from the instance uses ENA Express. To specify this setting, you must first enable ENA Express.

nested_items.name: ConnectionTrackingSpecification
nested_items.description: A security group connection tracking specification that enables you to set the timeout for connection tracking on an Elastic network interface. For more information, see Idle connection tracking timeout in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: TcpEstablishedTimeout
nested_items.description: for idle TCP connections in an established state. Min: 60 seconds. Max: 432000 seconds (5 days). Default: 432000 seconds. Recommended: Less than 432000 seconds.

nested_items.name: UdpTimeout
nested_items.description: for idle UDP flows that have seen traffic only in a single direction or a single request-response transaction. Min: 30 seconds. Max: 60 seconds. Default: 30 seconds.

nested_items.name: UdpStreamTimeout
nested_items.description: for idle UDP flows classified as streams which have seen more than one request-response transaction. Min: 60 seconds. Max: 180 seconds (3 minutes). Default: 180 seconds.

nested_items.name: ImageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI or a Systems Manager parameter. The Systems Manager parameter will resolve to the ID of the AMI at instance launch.
If an AMI ID was specified in the request, then this is the AMI ID.
If a Systems Manager parameter was specified in the request, and ResolveAlias was configured as true, then this is the AMI ID that the parameter is mapped to in the Parameter Store.
If a Systems Manager parameter was specified in the request, and ResolveAlias was configured as false, then this is the parameter value.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type.

nested_items.name: KeyName
nested_items.description: The name of the key pair.

nested_items.name: Monitoring
nested_items.description: The monitoring for the instance.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether detailed monitoring is enabled. Otherwise, basic monitoring is enabled.

nested_items.name: Placement
nested_items.description: The placement of the instance.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of the instance.

nested_items.name: Affinity
nested_items.description: The affinity setting for the instance on the Dedicated Host.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the placement group for the instance.

nested_items.name: HostId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Dedicated Host for the instance.

nested_items.name: Tenancy
nested_items.description: The tenancy of the instance. An instance with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware.

nested_items.name: SpreadDomain
nested_items.description: Reserved for future use.

nested_items.name: HostResourceGroupArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the host resource group in which to launch the instances.

nested_items.name: PartitionNumber
nested_items.description: The number of the partition the instance should launch in. Valid only if the placement group strategy is set to partition.

nested_items.name: GroupId
nested_items.description: The Group ID of the placement group. You must specify the Placement Group Group ID to launch an instance in a shared placement group.

nested_items.name: RamDiskId
nested_items.description: The ID of the RAM disk, if applicable.

nested_items.name: DisableApiTermination
nested_items.description: If set to true, indicates that the instance cannot be terminated using the Amazon EC2 console, command line tool, or API.

nested_items.name: InstanceInitiatedShutdownBehavior
nested_items.description: Indicates whether an instance stops or terminates when you initiate shutdown from the instance (using the operating system command for system shutdown).

nested_items.name: UserData
nested_items.description: The user data for the instance.

nested_items.name: TagSpecifications
nested_items.description: The tags that are applied to the resources that are created during instance launch.

nested_items.name: ResourceType
nested_items.description: The type of resource to tag.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags for the resource.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: ElasticGpuSpecifications
nested_items.description: Deprecated.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Deprecated.

nested_items.name: ElasticInferenceAccelerators
nested_items.description: An elastic inference accelerator to associate with the instance. Elastic inference accelerators are a resource you can attach to your Amazon EC2 instances to accelerate your Deep Learning (DL) inference workloads.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of elastic inference accelerator. The possible values are eia1.medium, eia1.large, and eia1.xlarge.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: The number of elastic inference accelerators to attach to the instance.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The security group IDs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The security group names.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceMarketOptions
nested_items.description: The market (purchasing) option for the instances.

nested_items.name: MarketType
nested_items.description: The market type.

nested_items.name: SpotOptions
nested_items.description: The options for Spot Instances.

nested_items.name: MaxPrice
nested_items.description: The maximum hourly price you're willing to pay for a Spot Instance. We do not recommend using this parameter because it can lead to increased interruptions. If you do not specify this parameter, you will pay the current Spot price. If you do specify this parameter, it must be more than USD $0.001. Specifying a value below USD $0.001 will result in an InvalidParameterValue error message when the launch template is used to launch an instance.

nested_items.name: SpotInstanceType
nested_items.description: The Spot Instance request type.

nested_items.name: BlockDurationMinutes
nested_items.description: The required duration for the Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks), in minutes. This value must be a multiple of 60 (60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360).

nested_items.name: ValidUntil
nested_items.description: The end date of the request. For a one-time request, the request remains active until all instances launch, the request is canceled, or this date is reached. If the request is persistent, it remains active until it is canceled or this date and time is reached.

nested_items.name: InstanceInterruptionBehavior
nested_items.description: The behavior when a Spot Instance is interrupted.

nested_items.name: CreditSpecification
nested_items.description: The credit option for CPU usage of the instance.

nested_items.name: CpuCredits
nested_items.description: The credit option for CPU usage of a T instance.

nested_items.name: CpuOptions
nested_items.description: The CPU options for the instance. For more information, see CPU options for Amazon EC2 instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: CoreCount
nested_items.description: The number of CPU cores for the instance.

nested_items.name: ThreadsPerCore
nested_items.description: The number of threads per CPU core.

nested_items.name: AmdSevSnp
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance is enabled for AMD SEV-SNP. For more information, see AMD SEV-SNP for Amazon EC2 instances.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationSpecification
nested_items.description: Information about the Capacity Reservation targeting option.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationPreference
nested_items.description: Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible preferences include:
open - The instance can run in any open Capacity Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform, Availability Zone).
none - The instance avoids running in a Capacity Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs in On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationTarget
nested_items.description: Information about the target Capacity Reservation or Capacity Reservation group.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the targeted Capacity Reservation.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationResourceGroupArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the targeted Capacity Reservation group.

nested_items.name: LicenseSpecifications
nested_items.description: The license configurations.

nested_items.name: LicenseConfigurationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the license configuration.

nested_items.name: HibernationOptions
nested_items.description: Indicates whether an instance is configured for hibernation. For more information, see Hibernate your Amazon EC2 instance in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Configured
nested_items.description: If this parameter is set to true, the instance is enabled for hibernation; otherwise, it is not enabled for hibernation.

nested_items.name: MetadataOptions
nested_items.description: The metadata options for the instance. For more information, see Configure the Instance Metadata Service options in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the metadata option changes.

nested_items.name: HttpTokens
nested_items.description: Indicates whether IMDSv2 is required.

optional - IMDSv2 is optional. You can choose whether to send a session token in your instance metadata retrieval requests. If you retrieve IAM role credentials without a session token, you receive the IMDSv1 role credentials. If you retrieve IAM role credentials using a valid session token, you receive the IMDSv2 role credentials.

required - IMDSv2 is required. You must send a session token in your instance metadata retrieval requests. With this option, retrieving the IAM role credentials always returns IMDSv2 credentials; IMDSv1 credentials are not available.

nested_items.name: HttpPutResponseHopLimit
nested_items.description: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number, the further instance metadata requests can travel.

nested_items.name: HttpEndpoint
nested_items.description: Enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on your instances. If the parameter is not specified, the default state is enabled.

nested_items.name: HttpProtocolIpv6
nested_items.description: Enables or disables the IPv6 endpoint for the instance metadata service.

nested_items.name: InstanceMetadataTags
nested_items.description: Set to enabled to allow access to instance tags from the instance metadata. Set to disabled to turn off access to instance tags from the instance metadata. For more information, see View tags for your EC2 instances using instance metadata.

nested_items.name: EnclaveOptions
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance is enabled for Amazon Web Services Nitro Enclaves.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: If this parameter is set to true, the instance is enabled for Amazon Web Services Nitro Enclaves; otherwise, it is not enabled for Amazon Web Services Nitro Enclaves.

nested_items.name: InstanceRequirements
nested_items.description: The attributes for the instance types. When you specify instance attributes, Amazon EC2 will identify instance types with these attributes.

nested_items.name: VCpuCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of vCPUs.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of vCPUs. If the value is 0, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of vCPUs. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: MemoryMiB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: CpuManufacturers
nested_items.description: The CPU manufacturers to include.
For instance types with Intel CPUs, specify intel.
For instance types with AMD CPUs, specify amd.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services CPUs, specify amazon-web-services.
For instance types with Apple CPUs, specify apple.

nested_items.name: MemoryGiBPerVCpu
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: ExcludedInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types to exclude.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGenerations
nested_items.description: Indicates whether current or previous generation instance types are included. The current generation instance types are recommended for use. Current generation instance types are typically the latest two to three generations in each instance family. For more information, see Instance types in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SpotMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for Spot Instances, as a percentage higher than an identified Spot price. The identified Spot price is the Spot price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. If no current generation C, M, or R instance type matches your attributes, then the identified Spot price is from the lowest priced current generation instance types, and failing that, from the lowest priced previous generation instance types that match your attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose Spot price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: OnDemandMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances, as a percentage higher than an identified On-Demand price. The identified On-Demand price is the price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: BareMetal
nested_items.description: Indicates whether bare metal instance types must be included, excluded, or required.
To include bare metal instance types, specify included.
To require only bare metal instance types, specify required.
To exclude bare metal instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: BurstablePerformance
nested_items.description: Indicates whether burstable performance T instance types are included, excluded, or required. For more information, see Burstable performance instances.
To include burstable performance instance types, specify included.
To require only burstable performance instance types, specify required.
To exclude burstable performance instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: RequireHibernateSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types must support hibernation for On-Demand Instances.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of network interfaces.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: LocalStorage
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types with instance store volumes are included, excluded, or required. For more information, Amazon EC2 instance store in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
To include instance types with instance store volumes, specify included.
To require only instance types with instance store volumes, specify required.
To exclude instance types with instance store volumes, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: LocalStorageTypes
nested_items.description: The type of local storage that is required.
For instance types with hard disk drive (HDD) storage, specify hdd.
For instance types with solid state drive (SSD) storage, specify ssd.

nested_items.name: TotalLocalStorageGB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total local storage, in GB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: BaselineEbsBandwidthMbps
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum baseline bandwidth to Amazon EBS, in Mbps. For more information, see Amazon EBS---optimized instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorTypes
nested_items.description: The accelerator types that must be on the instance type.
For instance types with FPGA accelerators, specify fpga.
For instance types with GPU accelerators, specify gpu.
For instance types with Inference accelerators, specify inference.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of accelerators (GPUs, FPGAs, or Amazon Web Services Inferentia chips) on an instance.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of accelerators. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of accelerators. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorManufacturers
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types must have accelerators by specific manufacturers.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services devices, specify amazon-web-services.
For instance types with AMD devices, specify amd.
For instance types with Habana devices, specify habana.
For instance types with NVIDIA devices, specify nvidia.
For instance types with Xilinx devices, specify xilinx.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorNames
nested_items.description: The accelerators that must be on the instance type.
For instance types with NVIDIA A10G GPUs, specify a10g.
For instance types with NVIDIA A100 GPUs, specify a100.
For instance types with NVIDIA H100 GPUs, specify h100.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services Inferentia chips, specify inferentia.
For instance types with NVIDIA GRID K520 GPUs, specify k520.
For instance types with NVIDIA K80 GPUs, specify k80.
For instance types with NVIDIA M60 GPUs, specify m60.
For instance types with AMD Radeon Pro V520 GPUs, specify radeon-pro-v520.
For instance types with NVIDIA T4 GPUs, specify t4.
For instance types with NVIDIA T4G GPUs, specify t4g.
For instance types with Xilinx VU9P FPGAs, specify vu9p.
For instance types with NVIDIA V100 GPUs, specify v100.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorTotalMemoryMiB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total accelerator memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: NetworkBandwidthGbps
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of network bandwidth, in gigabits per second (Gbps).

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AllowedInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaxSpotPriceAsPercentageOfOptimalOnDemandPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for Spot Instances, as a percentage of an identified On-Demand price. The identified On-Demand price is the price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. If no current generation C, M, or R instance type matches your attributes, then the identified price is from the lowest priced current generation instance types, and failing that, from the lowest priced previous generation instance types that match your attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: BaselinePerformanceFactors
nested_items.description: The baseline performance to consider, using an instance family as a baseline reference. The instance family establishes the lowest acceptable level of performance. Amazon EC2 uses this baseline to guide instance type selection, but there is no guarantee that the selected instance types will always exceed the baseline for every application. Currently, this parameter only supports CPU performance as a baseline performance factor. For more information, see Performance protection in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: References
nested_items.description: Specify an instance family to use as the baseline reference for CPU performance. All instance types that match your specified attributes will be compared against the CPU performance of the referenced instance family, regardless of CPU manufacturer or architecture differences.

nested_items.name: InstanceFamily
nested_items.description: The instance family to use as a baseline reference.
c1
g3 | g3s.
hpc7g.
m1 | m2
mac1 | mac2 | mac2-m1ultra | mac2-m2 | mac2-m2pro.
p3dn | p4d | p5
t1
u-12tb1 | u-18tb1 | u-24tb1 | u-3tb1 | u-6tb1 | u-9tb1 | u7i-12tb | u7in-16tb | u7in-24tb | u7in-32tb.

nested_items.name: PrivateDnsNameOptions
nested_items.description: The options for the instance hostname.

nested_items.name: HostnameType
nested_items.description: The type of hostname to assign to an instance.

nested_items.name: EnableResourceNameDnsARecord
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS A records.

nested_items.name: EnableResourceNameDnsAAAARecord
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS AAAA records.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceOptions
nested_items.description: The maintenance options for your instance.

nested_items.name: AutoRecovery
nested_items.description: Disables the automatic recovery behavior of your instance or sets it to default.

nested_items.name: DisableApiStop
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the instance is enabled for stop protection. For more information, see Enable stop protection for your EC2 instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Managed
nested_items.description: If true, the resource is managed by a service provider.

nested_items.name: Principal
nested_items.description: If managed is true, then the principal is returned. The principal is the service provider that manages the resource.

nested_items.name: NetworkPerformanceOptions
nested_items.description: Contains the launch template settings for network performance options for your instance.

nested_items.name: BandwidthWeighting
nested_items.description: When you configure network bandwidth weighting, you can boost baseline bandwidth for either networking or EBS by up to 25%. The total available baseline bandwidth for your instance remains the same. The default option uses the standard bandwidth configuration for your instance type.

nested_items.name: Managed
nested_items.description: If true, the resource is managed by a service provider.

nested_items.name: Principal
nested_items.description: If managed is true, then the principal is returned. The principal is the service provider that manages the resource.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results. This value is null when there are no more results to return.
